gantrytips.tip: The Gantry Framework includes a powerful Cache function. It caches the data and can greatly improve performance of the Gantry powered Joomla site.

The Gantry GZipper is a built-in compression and combination system that will ensure all Gantry CSS and JS files are combined and compressed to provide optimal performance. CSS and JS files outside of Gantry will not be included.
Turning this off stops the content component from displaying on the frontpage. Mainbody module positions are unaffected. This can be useful if you would like to build your homepage from modules only.
Turning this off stops the component, content top and bottom module positions, and sidebars from displaying on the homepage. All mainbody elements will be disabled.
The RTL setting allows you to enable Right-to-Left support in the gantry core. The Gantry template will be switched to RTL automatically as soon as a RTL language is detected.
Allow support for ?tp=1 functionality on the frontend. It is advisable to turn this off on production servers.

This will automatically put a class on the body tag in the format of menu-{menu alias}, for example menu-home is the class shown by default on the homepage. You can use this to add specific styling on specific pages.

This setting allows you to enable/disable the built-in custom RocketTheme extended typography. If you do not intend to use any extended RocketTheme typography styles on your site, disabling this option can increase performance by reducing the amount of CSS and images that load.
This setting allows you to enable/disable the built-in custom K2 styling support.
This setting allows you to enable/disable Selectivizr support for IE7 and IE8. Selectivizr provides support for additional CSS selectors in earlier versions of IE for better compatibility.
